Please remove alloc_new.h and use the functions in memory.h... there's a New<> that avoids macros and has already been vetted. We surely don't need another.

Why do we need new allocations?

Is ManualConstructor insufficient?
Those were the two pieces I was looking for. There were rumors that we already had the mechanisms to do these two things but folks weren't quite sure where they were, thanks for the pointers.

Overall, this looks really good.  Most of my comments are minor.

---

Reviewed 1 of 8 files at r1, 5 of 5 files at r2, 2 of 2 files at r4.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 11 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.cc, line 46 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8PuAa2ahzf6FB5GXz:-L-8PuAa2ahzf6FB5GY-:b-i9go40) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.cc#L46)):*
> ```cpp
> 
> Backoff::Backoff(const Options& options) : options_(options) {
>   rng_state_ = (unsigned int)gpr_now(GPR_CLOCK_REALTIME).tv_nsec;
> ```

We should use C++-style casting now, both here and throughout.

---

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 28 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8QK3Ul8COq4rKMMpj:-L-8QK3Ul8COq4rKMMpk:b-v64ldq) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L28)):*
> ```objc
> /// Implementation of the backoff mechanism described in
> /// doc/connection-backoff.md
> class Backoff {
> ```

Suggest capitalizing the 'o' to make this more readable.

---

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 89 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8OPQgN-KHcNonEIGc:-L-8OPQgN-KHcNonEIGd:b-dbb3wi) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L89)):*
>   struct Result {
>     /// Deadline to be used for the current attempt.
>     grpc_millis current_deadline;
>  
>     /// Deadline to be used for the next attempt, following the backoff
>     /// strategy.
>     grpc_millis next_attempt_start_time;
>   };

As per discussion in #13121, we were going to change this to return only the next attempt time, and move the deadline calculation into the subchannel code.  Can we do that as part of this PR, since we have to touch all of the callers anyway?  That way the new API can start out being very clean.

I would understand if you don't want to split this change off into a separate PR.  But in that case, I wonder if it would make sense to do that first.

---

*[test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc, line 29 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8QdMOntOX-Kr0Peay:-L-8QdMOntOX-Kr0Peaz:b5f1y63) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc#L29)):*
> ```cpp
> namespace {
> 
> static void test_constant_backoff(void) {
> ```

These functions no longer need to be `static`, since they're in an anonymous namespace.

---

*[test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc, line 45 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8Qj2IMEfKiHAToiWD:-L-8Qj2IMEfKiHAToiWE:bmfev4t) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc#L45)):*
> ```cpp
>   grpc_exec_ctx exec_ctx = GRPC_EXEC_CTX_INIT;
>   Backoff::Result next_deadlines = backoff.Begin(&exec_ctx);
>   GPR_ASSERT(next_deadlines.current_deadline - grpc_exec_ctx_now(&exec_ctx) ==
> ```

I suggest converting this file to use gtest, so that we can use `EXPECT_*` macros instead of `GPR_ASSERT`.  This provides much friendlier output when a test fails.  It also allows us to avoid stopping the test at the first failure.

---

*[test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc, line 203 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8QUDbON0QRzZeKN3b:-L-8QUDbON0QRzZeKN3c:b-9tz8dd) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc#L203)):*
> ```cpp
>   gpr_time_init();
> 
>   grpc_core::test_constant_backoff();
> ```

Another advantage of converting this to gtest format is that we can just call `RUN_ALL_TESTS()` instead of having to invoke each one individually.

---

Review status: 0 of 13 files reviewed at latest revision, 11 unresolved discussions. --- *[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.cc, line 46 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8PuAa2ahzf6FB5GXz:-L-E9ZWjRG_pXewUeJQ3:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.cc#L46)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
We should use C++-style casting now, both here and throughout.
Done. --- *[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 28 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8QK3Ul8COq4rKMMpj:-L-E9lEPEEMBrydAqJt-:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L28)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
Suggest capitalizing the 'o' to make this more readable.
Done. --- *[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 89 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8OPQgN-KHcNonEIGc:-L-Z6MPvXYh53VPWuFhz:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L89)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
> struct Result { > /// Deadline to be used for the current attempt. > grpc_millis current_deadline; >   > /// Deadline to be used for the next attempt, following the backoff > /// strategy. > grpc_millis next_attempt_start_time; > }; As per discussion in #13121, we were going to change this to return only the next attempt time, and move the deadline calculation into the subchannel code. Can we do that as part of this PR, since we have to touch all of the callers anyway? That way the new API can start out being very clean. I would understand if you don't want to split this change off into a separate PR. But in that case, I wonder if it would make sense to do that first.
Done. --- *[test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc, line 29 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8QdMOntOX-Kr0Peay:-L-E9qH8sd5nF-SLkZne:b9m1y8i) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc#L29)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
These functions no longer need to be `static`, since they're in an anonymous namespace.
Not applicable anymore --- *[test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc, line 45 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8Qj2IMEfKiHAToiWD:-L-E9ry8aUOfIKA-H0tG:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc#L45)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
I suggest converting this file to use gtest, so that we can use `EXPECT_*` macros instead of `GPR_ASSERT`. This provides much friendlier output when a test fails. It also allows us to avoid stopping the test at the first failure.
Done. --- *[test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc, line 203 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-8QUDbON0QRzZeKN3b:-L-EAuY_asePFpTNP3oK:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d3f6eae6694189bc9547acc6a95f9c94add4508b/test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc#L203)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
Another advantage of converting this to gtest format is that we can just call `RUN_ALL_TESTS()` instead of having to invoke each one individually.
Done. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494)*

---

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.cc, line 63 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-bvn67zFLsSOW3wOvX:-L-bvn67zFLsSOW3wOvY:b-qna9bm) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/6667f15d8e4ea915bd64647e2c7949d37d1bad91/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.cc#L63)):*
> ```cpp
>       options_.jitter() * current_backoff_);
>   const grpc_millis next_timeout = std::min(
>       (grpc_millis)(current_backoff_ + jitter), options_.max_backoff());
> ```

I like this step of capping jitter. Should we update the spec in the same way? Currently in the spec this step does not exist and `next_timeout` may go above `max_backoff()`.

---

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 36 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-c4ILm8BMajNHwQFag:-L-c4ILm8BMajNHwQFah:b-69147h) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/6667f15d8e4ea915bd64647e2c7949d37d1bad91/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L36)):*
> ```objc
> 
>   /// Begin retry loop: returns the deadline to be used for the next attempt,
>   /// following the backoff / strategy.
> ```

"backoff / strategy" doesn't need the '/'.

---

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 37 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-c4VfU2gFAYvTAa3n6:-L-c4VfU2gFAYvTAa3n7:b-mnhat0) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/6667f15d8e4ea915bd64647e2c7949d37d1bad91/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L37)):*
> ```objc
>   /// Begin retry loop: returns the deadline to be used for the next attempt,
>   /// following the backoff / strategy.
>   grpc_millis Begin(grpc_exec_ctx* exec_ctx);
> ```

Just an idea, feel free to push back: Would it make sense to use internal state to track whether or not this is the first attempt instead of requiring the caller to do so, so that we can combine `Begin()` and `Step()` into a single method?

---

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 38 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-c45mMrO4S21xc6B9b:-L-c45mMrO4S21xc6B9c:b-jbvx6v) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/6667f15d8e4ea915bd64647e2c7949d37d1bad91/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L38)):*
> ```objc
>   /// following the backoff / strategy.
>   grpc_millis Begin(grpc_exec_ctx* exec_ctx);
>   /// Step a retry loop: returns returns the deadline to be used for the next
> ```

"returns returns" -> "returns"

*[src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h, line 39 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-c4Be2oL2yn1v8b41S:-L-c4Be2oL2yn1v8b41T:b-dzoqe5) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/6667f15d8e4ea915bd64647e2c7949d37d1bad91/src/core/lib/backoff/backoff.h#L39)):*

Remove the '/' prior to "following".

*[test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc, line 57 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-c5duuOt6zzxtacPtG:-L-c5duvrS-C8b2JsFMt:b-x64m6a) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/6667f15d8e4ea915bd64647e2c7949d37d1bad91/test/core/backoff/backoff_test.cc#L57)):*

*[doc/connection-backoff.md, line 30 at r8](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13494#-L-cm1opW04oHQboOdTl:-L-cm1opW04oHQboOdTm:b8h030a) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/8df0cc3363475b2f8d0775a95809fa7149e26af1/doc/connection-backoff.md#L30)):*
> ```Markdown
>     current_backoff = Min(current_backoff * MULTIPLIER, MAX_BACKOFF)

>     current_deadline = now() + Min(current_backoff + jitter, MAX_BACKOFF)
